zone.line: I saw two azure halcyons clinging downward
bunch
And thinning one bright mass of amber berries
With quick long beaks, & in the deep there lay
Those lovely forms imaged as in a sky—
So with my thoughts full of these happy changes
We meet again, the happiest change of all.
Enter, the Spirit of the Hour
Prometheus
We feel what thou hast heard & seen—yet speak
Spirit
Soon as the thu sound had ceased whose thunder
of sky filled
The abysses the air , & the wide earth; 410
There was a change...the impalpable thin air
The light And the all-circling sunlight were
transformed
As if the sense of love dissolved in them
And folded itself round the sphered world.
My vision then grew clear & I could see
Into the mysteries of the Universe
Dizzy as with delight I floated down
Winnowing the lightsome air with languid
birthplace plumes
My coursers sought their pastures in the sun
